(4") nominal size shall be placed to each lot from the lot line to the sewer
main. A cleanout shall be provided upon each lateral just within the boundary
line of the lot served.
      5.   Sewer Opening: Manholes shall be constructed in sewer mains at every
change of mode or direction, and along straight portions of mains, so that no
point in any main shall be farther from the nearest manhole than two hundred
fifty feet (250'). A lamphole or manhole must be provided at the end of all
sewer mains. Manholes and lampholes shall be installed in accordance with the
county specifications.
      6.   Stormwaters: No stormwater drains shall be connected to any sewer
main or lateral.
   (F)   Trenching: All water and sewer mains and laterals shall be placed and
the backfill compacted prior to the surfacing of streets affected. County road
excavation permits shall not be required for trenching required to place water
and sewer systems in subdivision streets prior to road surfacing when the
construction of such systems are secured by a subdivision bond or deposit. The
county shall be notified at least twenty four (24) hours prior to commencement
of any such work.
   (G)   Trees: Following construction, new trees suitable to the environment
shall be planted in a ratio of three (3) new trees for each three (3)
originally removed except those where dense stands of younger growth have been
thinned for better forest management.
   (H)   Signs: At least one street sign of a type and character as approved by
the county shall be placed at each street intersection.
   (I)   Underground Utilities: If required by the planning commission and the
board of county commissioners, all utilities for direct service to land
developments, building sites and structures shall be installed underground. The
owner or developer is responsible for complying with the requirements of this
section and shall make all the necessary arrangements for the installation of
such facilities.
For the purpose of this section, appurtenances and associated equipment such
as, but not limited to, surface mounted transformers, pedestal mounted terminal
boxes, and meter cabinets and concealed ducts in underground systems can be
placed above ground.
All underground utilities, sanitary sewers and storm drains installed in
streets, service roads, alleys, or highways shall be constructed before the
surfacing of such street, service road, alleys or highways. Service connection
for all underground utilities and sanitary sewers shall be laid to such length
as will alleviate the necessity for disturbing the street or alley improvements
when service connections therein are made; however, boring of such lines will
be permitted. (Ord. 1974-E, 2-7-1974)
5-7-5: ACCEPTANCE OF WORK:
   (A)   When all improvement work required by the improvement plans, or a
complete unit thereof, is complete to the satisfaction of the county inspector,
then he shall issue a certificate to the county commissioners stating that such
a portion of the work has been satisfactorily completed and recommends the
acceptance of the county commissioners of the completed portion of the work.
   (B)   Upon satisfactory completion of all work required to meet the
requirements of this title and its acceptance by the county commissioners, the
county commissioners shall file a notice of completion as to the required
improvements in the office of the county recorder.
   (C)   Any unexpended cash deposits not required for completion of the work
shall be refunded or bonds held released.
   (D)   In land developments in which the county commissioners require that
nongovernmental improvements be completed to governmental standards, upon
certification by the county that such nongovernmental improvements have been
completed to government standards, the governing body may release that portion
of the performance bonds covering the nongovernmental improvements. (Ord. 1974-
E, 2-7-1974)
5-7-6: INSPECTION AND CONTROL FOR IMPROVEMENTS OFFERED TO THE COUNTY:
   (A)   All work done in constructing improvements and all materials furnished
shall be subject to the inspection of the county.
   (B)   The county shall have access to work at all times during its
construction and shall be furnished with each and every reasonable facility for
ascertaining that the materials as used and the workmanship are in accordance
with the requirements of this division.
   (C)   If any of the work on improvements is done by the developer prior to
the approval of the improvement plans or prior to the inspection of the
improvements as required by the county, such work may be rejected and shall be
deemed to have been done at the risk and peril of the developer. (Ord. 1974-E,
2-7-1974)
5-7-7: INSPECTION FEE FOR IMPROVEMENTS OFFERED TO THE COUNTY:
   (A)   Prior to the commencement of construction, the developer shall pay to
the Elko County division of planning and zoning a sum equivalent to two percent
(2%) of the estimated construction cost as a prepayment of inspection fees.
Inspection fees will be charged at a reasonable rate (including costs) for the
service performed and the necessary adjustment made at the time of bond
release. (Ord. 2015-12, 7-8-2015, eff. 2-21-2016)
   (B)   The cost of improvements as such shall be based on the estimated
construction cost, or on a construction contract if awarded prior to the filing
of the final map with the county commissioners. If any portion of the work has
been done at the time of depositing the fee, the developer shall pay to the
county commissioners all necessary cost plus fifteen percent (15%) thereof for
the inspection and testing required to verify the actual quantity and quality
of the work done. (Ord. 1974-E, 2-7-1974)
5-7-8: PROSECUTION OF WORK:
The developer shall prosecute the work to completion without undue delay except
for inclement weather or other reasonable cause.
Delay in the completion of the work beyond the period stated in the agreement,
unless an extension thereof is approved by the county commissioners and the
surety company, may result in forfeiture of the cash deposit and/or security or
a portion thereof for the completion of the work. (Ord. 1974-E, 2-7-1974)
CHAPTER 8
EXEMPTIONS
SECTION:
5-8-1: Definitions
5-8-2: Petition Required
5-8-3: Determination Upon Petition
5-8-4: Violation; Penalty
5-8-5: Action For Relief
5-8-1: DEFINITIONS:
COMMISSION: The duly acting and authorized agency of the Elko County
Commissioners known more fully as the Elko County Planning Commission.
DEPARTMENT OR ELKO COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT: For purposes of
this Chapter, the Elko County Director of Planning.
OFFERING: Any plot of land the area of which is six hundred forty (640) or more
acres and which is part and parcel of any number of plots offered for sale,
disposition, lease, hypothecation, wherein the petitioning party seeks to
dispose of plots of land for gain or otherwise by contract of sale, recorded or
otherwise to purchasers however constituted as individuals, corporations,
trusts, partnerships, unincorporated associations, associations or any other
legal entity however constituted as purchaser.
PETITION: Shall constitute a questionnaire filed with the Elko County
Department of Community Development by a petitioning party.
PETITIONING PARTY: Every party, firm, corporation, partnership, unincorporated
association, individual, association, developer, or any other legal entity
however constituted, submitting a petition as herein provided evidencing its
status as that coming in the provisions of The Elko County Subdivision
Ordinance.
QUESTIONNAIRE: The questionnaire adopted for usage pursuant to this Chapter and
shall include the following questions to be answered by the petitioning party.
Nothing in the limitations of the questions herein contained shall be construed
to prevent the Elko County Department of Community Development from
ascertaining other facts as are applicable, material and relevant to the
petition:
   I.   General Information
      1.   Name and/or unit number(s) included in this filing as shown on
recorded map(s) or on records of survey.
      2.   Will this project be developed or sold in unit increments? Yes or
No.
   II.   Developer Interests
      1.   List the name, address and type and extent of each holder of ten
percent (10%) or more ownership interest in the land included in this offering.
If other than an individual, name the type of legal entity and list the type
and interest of each principal.
      2.   If the developer does not own an interest in the land, list the name
and address of each individual or entity having an ownership interest in the
development. Also list the name, address and principal occupation of each
officer, director, associate owner or trustee officer of the developer. State
the financial or business relationship between the developer and owner of the
subdivision.
      3.   If the developer is a corporation, submit a copy of the articles of
incorporation with all amendments thereto and a current list of the officers of
the corporation, their addresses and principal occupations.
      If the developer is a trust, submit copies of the instruments creating
the trust.
      If the developer is a partnership, unincorporated association, joint
stock company or any other form of organization, submit copies of the articles
of partnership or association and all other documents relating to its
organization.
      4.   If the developer is a corporation and is organized under the laws of
another state, submit a certified copy of their certificate of qualification
for the transaction of business in Nevada issued by the Nevada Secretary of
State indicating the corporation's resident agent.
      5.   If the developer is a Nevada corporation, submit a certified copy of
the certificate of incorporation for the transaction of business in Nevada
issued by the Nevada Secretary of State indicating the corporation's resident
agent.
   III.   Location and Size of Lots Contained in this Filing
      1.   County and State where located.
      2.   List the name and populations of surrounding communities and list
distances over paved or unpaved road to the subdivision.
      Name of   Population   Distance over   Unpaved
      Community   (Approximate)   Paved Roads   Roads   Total
      3.   Name the streets or highways adjacent to subdivision.
      4.   Name of nearby cross streets.
      5.   Total number of lots or parcels in subdivision.
      6.   Total number of acres in subdivision.
      7.   Total number of lots or parcels in this filing.
      8.   Total number of acres in this filing.
      9.   Do you plan to offer the property described herein for sale? for
lease?          for option?         other?        .

      11.   Will each lot be marked with permanent monuments prior to sale? Yes
or No.
   IV.   Title and Subdivision Map Information
      1.   Submit a map showing a master plan of the project.
      2.   Submit a copy of recorded plat for each unit included in this
filing. Said map to include title sheet, if any, or evidence that recorded plat
is not required by local authority. If a recorded map is not required, submit a
record of survey or some kind of map delineating the parcel to be sold.
      3.   Submit preliminary title report or equivalent document suitable to
the Department issued after final unit maps are recorded. The title report
shall not be dated earlier than twenty (20) business days prior to the filing
of this questionnaire.
      4.   Any easements mentioned in the preliminary title report or record of
survey map must be shown on recorded plat or parcel map.
      5.   On the map submitted in this Section, delineate the land owned under
option or similar agreement. Also delineate the land included in this offering.

The petitioning party shall append to the questionnaire as part of the same the
following verification:

this form constitute an intention to dispose of lands in Elko County under
benefit of "The Elko County Subdivision Ordinance", and that the statements
together with any documents submitted herewith are full, true, complete and
correct; and that I (we) am (are) the owner(s) of the parcels herein described.

THE ELKO COUNTY SUBDIVISION ORDINANCE: That ordinance, adopted by the Elko
County Commissioners on May 25, 1971, and amended thereafter in manner as
provided by law by the Elko County Commissioners, being in particular Chapters
1 to 7, inclusive, of this Title 5. (Ord. 1997-A, 3-20-1997, eff. 3-20-1997)
5-8-2: PETITION REQUIRED:
Every petitioning party who claims benefit in any land sales promotion of the
provisions of The Elko County Subdivision Ordinance shall, before proceeding to
actively engage in the disposition, sale, advertising, promotion or before
engaging in any affirmative act in pursuit of the sale, disposition or
advertising for sale of the subject land sought to be disposed of without
classification as a subdivision and in reliance upon The Elko County
Subdivision Ordinance, shall first file with the Elko County Department of
Community Development a petition stating that it is in fact entitled to the
benefit of The Elko County Subdivision Ordinance. (Ord. 1997-A, 3-20-1997, eff.
3-20-1997)
5-8-3: DETERMINATION UPON PETITION:
If there is a determination by the Department of Community Development that the
petitioning party is not one which qualifies for treatment under the
Subdivision Ordinance of the County, the Department shall so notify the
District Attorney who shall seek appropriate judicial relief pursuant to law.
(Ord. 1997-A, 3-20-1997, eff. 3-20-1997)
5-8-4: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
It shall be unlawful for any party to wilfully violate the provisions of this
Chapter. Any violation of this Chapter shall be punishable by fine not to
exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00) or by imprisonment in the County jail for
a period not to exceed six (6) months, or by both such fine and imprisonment as
deemed appropriate in the discretion of the court. Each act, transaction, offer
for sale, advertisement and furtherance of sale or any other act that
reasonably constitutes an offering of land for sale by any party who commits
such act without first having complied with the provisions of this Chapter
shall be deemed to constitute a separate offense. The imposition of any
sentence shall not exempt the offender from the compliance with the
requirements of this Chapter. (Ord. 1974-F, 3-14-1974)
5-8-5: ACTION FOR RELIEF:
Nothing herein shall preclude the Commission or the County Commissioners by and
through their authorized legal counsel from bringing any action at law or
sounding in equity or seeking injunctive restraining or temporary or permanent
relief from violations of this Chapter.
If at any time before or after the filing of a petition as herein provided it
appears at the discretion of the Commission, the County Commissioners, the
Department of Community Development or the District Attorney of the County that
a violation of this Chapter is occurring, the District Attorney, as legal
counsel to the Commission and the County Commissioners, shall seek appropriate
relief as hereinabove detailed to curtail such violations. Further, if it shall
appear that the petitioning party is conducting itself in a manner so as to
disqualify itself from treatment under the County Subdivision Ordinance, the
District Attorney shall seek relief as hereinabove detailed. (Ord. 1997-A, 3-
20-1997, eff. 3-20-1997)
TITLE 6
BUSINESS REGULATIONS
CHAPTER 1
BUSINESS LICENSES, MOUNTAIN CITY
SECTION:
6-1-1: Definitions
6-1-2: License Required
6-1-3: Separate Violations
6-1-4: Form and Record of License
6-1-5: Transfer of License
6-1-6: Exhibiting License
6-1-7: License Fee a Civil Obligation
6-1-8: License Fees
6-1-9: Exemptions
6-1-10: Duties of Police
6-1-11: Suits Brought for Delinquent Fees; Attachments
6-1-12: Establishing Rates
6-1-13: Classification of Businesses
6-1-14: Revocation
6-1-15: Refunds
6-1-1: DEFINITIONS:
Unless it is apparent from the context that another meaning is intended, the
following words when used herein shall have the meaning attached to them when
used in this Chapter.
TOWN: Whenever the word "Town" shall appear, it shall be construed to mean the
unincorporated Town of Mountain City.
PERSON: Whenever the word "person" shall appear, it shall be construed to mean
and include a natural person, firm, co- partnership, corporation or other
association.
BUSINESS: Whenever the word "business" shall appear, it shall be construed to
mean any activity or enterprise for gain, benefit, advantage or livelihood and
shall include all and every kind of lawful business, trade, calling, profession
or occupation.
PEDDLER: The word "peddler" shall be construed to mean any hawker, vendor or
other person who goes from house to house, place to place, or in or along the
streets, selling and making immediate delivery or offering for sale and
immediate delivery, any goods, wares, merchandise or anything of value in
possession of the peddler, to persons other than manufacturers, wholesalers,
jobbers or retailers in such commodities; providing, however, that this does
not apply to those businesses licensed within the Town who normally conduct
peddling operations as a normal or seasonal part of their business.
SOLICITOR: The word "solicitor" shall be deemed to mean and include every
agent, canvasser, or other person who travels from place to place or house to
house and solicits or takes orders from or canvasses for, or makes
demonstrations of any goods, wares, merchandise or things or articles of value,
or advertising, or for services to be performed in the future, or for
subscriptions to periodicals or tickets of admission to entertainment or
memberships in any clubs, or travels from place to place or house to house and
solicits, requests or urges persons to ride or become guests of such canvasser
or his principal for the purpose of viewing any real estate subdivision or
other development, enterprise or project, for the purpose of interesting such
person in investment therein; provided, however, that this definition shall not
include persons engaging in any wholesale business who sell to, or solicit
orders for merchandise from, merchants who are engaged in a retail business
buying goods, wares, merchandise or other personal property for the purpose of
resale thereof.
FIXED PLACE OF BUSINESS: The term "fixed place of business" for the purpose of
this Chapter is hereby defined to be the premises within the Town where a
business is continuously conducted from day to day and regularly kept open for
the purpose of the business. The term "regular place of business", for the
purpose of this division, is hereby defined as having the same meaning as
"fixed place of business". Every business not conducted at a "fixed place of
business" as the term is herein defined, is, for the purpose of this Chapter
termed a "transient business", whether the person conducting such transient
business is or is not a resident of the Town.
Every person engaging in any "transient business" in the Town, as herein
defined, and who has procured a license therefor, shall have the right to sell
the goods, wares or merchandise or engage in the business for which the
"transient license" was issued, at a fixed place of business without procuring
any additional license therefor. Every person engaging in business at a "fixed
place of business", as herein defined and who has procured a license therefor
shall have the right to deliver the goods, wares or merchandise for which such
license was issued at any place in the Town, without procuring any additional
license therefor.
No business shall be conducted at any fixed place of business where such
business is prohibited by the zoning laws of the Town, and no license shall be
issued for any place of business unless the zoning laws permit or allow such
business to be conducted at the location for which application is made.
No bedroom of any place of business licensed, used and occupied as a hotel,
motel, inn, rooming house, lodging house or boarding house shall, for the
purpose of this Chapter, ever be construed to be a "fixed place of business" or
a "regular place of business" for any business other than such hotel, motel,
inn, rooming house, lodging house or boarding house. All persons claiming any
such room of such hotel, motel, inn, rooming house, lodging house or boarding
house, licensed, used and occupied as such, shall, for the purposes of this
Chapter, be deemed to be conducting a transient business, and shall be required
to procure a proper transient license therefor.
WHOLESALE BUSINESS: The term "wholesale business" is defined to be every
business conducted solely for the purpose of selling goods, wares or
merchandise in wholesale lots to retail merchants for resale at retail.
RETAIL BUSINESS: The term "retail business" is defined to be every business
conducted for the purpose of selling, or offering for sale, any goods, wares or
merchandise other than as a part of a "wholesale business" as hereinbefore
defined.
GROSS SALES: The term "gross sales" as used herein shall mean the gross sales
received from business transacted within the Town and shall include the total
amount of sales price of all sales, the total amount charged or received for
the performance of any act, service or employment of whatever nature it may be,
whether such service, act or employment is done as a part of or in connection
with the sale of goods, wares or not, for which a charge is made or credit
allowed, including all receipts, cash, credits and property of any kind or
nature; provided, that cash discounts be included and this Chapter shall not be
construed to impose any tax upon any business or transaction which the Town is
not authorized to license or tax under the laws of the State of Nevada or of
the United States. Any tax required by lava to be included or added to the
purchase price and collected from a customer or purchaser is deductible. Such
part of the sales price of any property previously sold, returned by the
purchaser to the seller, which is refunded by the seller by way of cash or
credit allowances or any property given by the purchaser to the seller as a
part of the purchase price and so accepted for resale shall be deducted for the
purpose of determining the gross sales hereunder. Any business which maintains
an office or base of operations only in the Town and does no local business,
must obtain a license based upon the minimum fee. The terms "gross sales" and
"gross receipts" are the same.
LICENSE FEE: The term "license fee" as used herein shall be defined as the fee
paid for a business license.
TOWN BOARD: Whenever the term "Town Board" shall appear, it shall be construed
to mean the Board of County Commissioners of Elko County, acting pursuant to
authority granted in Chapter 269, Nevada Revised Statutes.
CLERK: Whenever the term "Clerk" shall appear, it shall be construed to mean
the County Clerk of the County of Elko.
SHERIFF: Whenever the term "Sheriff" shall appear, it shall be construed to
mean the Sheriff of Elko County.
CHIEF OF POLICE: Whenever the term "Chief of Police" shall appear, it shall be
construed to mean the Chief of Police of the unincorporated Town of Mountain
City. (Ord. 1967A, 10-6-67; amd. 1-8-68)
6-1-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person, whether as principal or agent, clerk or
employee, either for himself or any other person, to commence or carry on any
kind of business, trade, calling, profession or occupation within the
unincorporated Town of Mountain City without first having procured a license to
do so, or without complying with any and all regulations of such business,
trade, calling, profession or occupation contained in this Chapter.
6-1-3: SEPARATE VIOLATIONS:
The carrying on of any business, trade, calling, profession or occupation
within the unincorporated Town without first having procured a license so to
do, or without complying with any and all regulations of such business, trade,
calling, profession or occupation contained in this Chapter, shall be deemed a
separate violation of this Chapter for each and every day that such business,
trade, calling, profession or occupation is carried on. (Ord. 1967A; 10-6-67)
6-1-4: FORM AND RECORD OF LICENSE:
All licenses provided by this Chapter to be procured shall be printed in
duplicate in appropriate form, and shall be so printed that on issuance, the
trade or profession licensed and the name or names of the party or parties to
whom the license is granted, and the time for which the same is granted shall
be indicated; and before issuance they shall be signed by the Chairman of the
Town Board and countersigned by the Clerk.
The Sheriff shall keep in his office a set of books, to be called the "Town
License Register" in which he shall enter the name or names of all parties to
whom he issued licenses, the business, trade or profession licensed, the time
for which license holds good, the date of its expiration and the amount
received therefor; and he shall exhibit such books to the Town Board whenever
required to do so. (Ord. 1967A, 10-6-67; amd. 1-8-68)
6-1-5: TRANSFER OF LICENSE:
No license shall be valid except for the location for which the original
application therefore was made and the license issued. In the event of the
transfer of such licensed business to another locale, the original license
shall be presented to the Clerk, together with a statement of such transfer,
setting forth the proposed location. The license, together with the statement
of transfer, shall be presented to the Town Board and upon their approval the
Clerk may transfer the license. No license shall be transferred nor shall it be
changed except when the business changes the name, but not the character nor
ownership of the business.
6-1-6: EXHIBITING LICENSE:
Every person having a license under the provisions of this Chapter for carrying
on a business at a fixed place of business, shall exhibit such license in some
conspicuous part of the place of business. Every person having such a license
and not having a fixed place of business shall carry such license with him at
all times while carrying on the business for which the same was granted. Every
person having such a license shall produce and exhibit same whenever requested
to do so by any police officer or by any officer authorized to issue, inspect
or collect licenses.
6-1-7: LICENSE FEE A CIVIL OBLIGATION:
   (A)   The amount of any license fee imposed by the provisions of this
Chapter shall be deemed a debt to the Town, and any person carrying on any
business without having a license so to do shall be subject to an action in the
name of the Town or in the name of the County in any court of competent
jurisdiction for the collection of the amount of license fee by this Chapter
imposed on such business. All costs of such action shall be assessed to and
borne by the person carrying on such business.
   (B)   The conviction and punishment of any person for transacting any
business without a license shall not excuse or exempt such persons from the
payment of such license tax due or unpaid at the time of such conviction and
nothing herein shall prevent a criminal prosecution for any violation of the
provisions of this Chapter.
6-1-8: LICENSE FEES:
   (A)   Annual Licenses. The license period shall be from July 1 of each year
through June 30 of the following year. All annual license fees shall be paid in
advance upon the original issuance and annually or semi-annually thereafter at
the office of the Clerk in legal currency of the United States, payment to be
made in amounts as follows:
      1.   If the application is made during the half year preceding January 1,
the license fee shall be one hundred percent (100%) of the annual license fee.
      2.   If the application is made during the half year commencing January
1, the license fee shall be fifty percent (50%) of the annual license fee.
All annual licenses shall be due and payable on the first day of July of each
year and shall be and become delinquent on July 31 next thereafter and shall
expire on June 30 of each year.
   (B)   Daily Licenses. The daily licenses in this Chapter provided shall be
due and payable to the Town each day in advance. The daily license shall cover
a period of twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight to twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight
of the day next thereafter.
   (C)   Penalty. If any license provided for by this Chapter shall remain
unpaid for more than thirty (30) days after the same is due, a penalty of
twenty five percent (25%) shall be added to the same and collected by the
officer or employee of the Town having charge of the collection of licenses. If
this license fee and the penalty remain unpaid for fifteen (15) days, the
license shall forthwith be cancelled.
6-1-9: EXEMPTIONS:
   (A)   Charities, Etc. The provisions of this Chapter shall not be deemed or
construed to require the payment of a license to conduct, manage, or carry on
any business, occupation or activity or require the payment of any license from
any institution or organization which is conducted, managed or carried on
wholly for the benefit of charitable purposes from which profit is not derived
either directly or indirectly by any person; nor shall any license be required
for the conducting of any entertainment, dance, concert, exhibition or lecture
on scientific, historical, literary, religious or moral subjects whenever the
entire receipts from the same are to be appropriated to or the projects are
conducted under the auspices of any church, school or any religious, nonprofit
or benevolent organization; nor shall any license be required for the
conducting of any entertainment, dance, concert, exhibition or lecture whenever
the receipts from the same are to be appropriated for the purposes and objects
for which such association or organization was formed and from which profit is
not derived either directly or indirectly by any person; provided, however,
that nothing in this Section contained shall be deemed to exempt any such
institution or organization from complying with the provisions of this Chapter
requiring such institution or organization to obtain a permit to conduct,
manage or carry on any profession, trade, calling or occupation. In the
enforcement of this Section, pay which is earned by any person from a religious
or charitable organization shall not be termed profit.
   (B)   Commercial Travelers. No license shall be required or fee collected
from any person whose business is limited to the taking of orders for future
delivery of goods, wares, merchandise or supplies to businessmen in the Town
for their use or resale by them in the normal course of their business.
6-1-10: DUTIES OF POLICE:
The Sheriff, and/or the Chief of Police, or either of them shall have and
exercise power to:
   (A)   Make arrests for the violation of any of the provisions of this
Chapter;
   (B)   Enter any place of business for which a license is required and
provided and demand the exhibition of such license for the current term from
any person engaged or employed in the transaction of such business. If such
person shall then and there fail to exhibit such license, such person shall be
guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be liable for the penalty or penalties
provided herein.
It is hereby made the duty of the Sheriff or Chief of Police to cause
complaints to be filed against all persons, firms or corporations violating any
of the provisions of this Chapter.
6-1-11: SUITS BROUGHT FOR DELINQUENT FEES; ATTACHMENTS:
   (A)   The Town Board may at any time direct the District Attorney to bring
suit in the name of the Town for the recovery of the required license tax
against any person who engages in, conducts or carries on any business or game
or exhibits any show or exhibition without first obtaining the required license
and paying the prescribed license tax. In such actions for collections of a
license tax hereby imposed, a penalty of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be added
to the amount of any judgment recovered by the Town in addition to any other
penalty or penalties then due and owing and imposed by the provisions of this
Chapter.
   (B)   In all suits instituted by the Town and/or County, as herein provided
for the collection or the recovery of any license tax hereby imposed, the Clerk
or the District Attorney may make the necessary affidavit for a Writ of
Attachment against the property of the defendant therein, and such Writ shall
thereupon be issued without any undertaking or other security being given or on
behalf of the Town and/or County.

(B) Vending Machines, Service Machines, Amusement Machines, Music Machines:
   1. For every person engaged in the business of owning, maintaining or operating
any machine or machines at an established place of business for the vending of     $ 10.00/
goods, wares or merchandise or for the rendering of any service or information,    year
into any of which machines money or tokens of value are deposited or paid for the
operation thereof
   Businesses otherwise licensed under the provisions of this Chapter who own
vending machines shall not be required to pay a further license fee under this
Section.
   2. For every person engaged in the business of maintaining or operating any
machine or machines for the purpose of amusement or demonstration of skill, or any $ 10.00/
combination amusement and vending machine into any of which machines money or any  year
token of value must be deposited to operate the machine or machines, the license
fee shall be
      a. The term "amusement machine" shall mean any machine which, upon the
insertion of a coin, slug, token, plate, or disc, may be operated by the public
generally for use as a game, entertainment or amusement, whether or not
registering a score. It shall include, among others, such devices as marble
machines, pinball machines, skill ball, mechanical grab machines and all games,
operations or transactions similar thereto under whatever name they may be
indicated.
      b. Nothing in this Chapter shall in any way be construed to authorize,
license or permit any gambling devices whatsoever, or any machine, or mechanism
that has been judicially determined to be a gambling device by the laws of the
State of Nevada or by the Nevada Gaming Commission or the Nevada State Gaming
Control Board or such other board, commission, agency or department of the State
of Nevada. No such amusement machine shall be used or operated as a gambling
device. Any licensee who shall use or operate any such amusement machine as a
gambling device, or who shall permit any such amusement machine to be used or
operated as a gambling device shall be guilty of a misdemeanor.
      c. Every license issued under this Chapter for an amusement machine is
subject to the right which is hereby expressly reserved, to revoke such license
should the licensee directly or indirectly permit, cause or allow the operation of
any amusement machine as a gambling device or in any other way contrary to the
provisions of this Chapter. Said license may be revoked by the Town Board after
written notice to the licensee, which notice shall specify the violation with
which the licensee is charged, if after a hearing the licensee is found to be
guilty of such violation. Ten (10) days' notice of the hearing shall be given the
licensee. At such hearing the licensee and his attorney may present and submit
evidence and witnesses in his defense. If the Sheriff or Chief of Police shall
have reason to believe that any amusement machine is used as a gambling device,
such machine may be seized by the police and impounded and if upon hearing as
herein provided the licensee is found guilty of using such amusement machine as a
gambling device, or permitting the use of such amusement machine as a gambling
device, such machine shall be destroyed by the police.
   3. For every person engaged in the business of maintaining or operating any
machine or device for the producing of music into which machine or device money or $ 10.00/
tokens of value are deposited or paid for the operation thereof, the license fee   year
shall be
   4. No person shall be required to pay a license fee on any machine used for the
vending of matches or United States Postage Stamps, or the placing of telephone
calls or where the value of the merchandise vended or service rendered shall be
less than five cents ($.05).

(F) Solicitors. An applicant for a license under this Section must file with the
Sheriff or Chief of Police a sworn application in writing on a form to be
furnished by the Clerk, which shall give the following information:
   1. Name and description of the applicant;
   2. Permanent home address and full local address of the applicant;
   3. A brief description of the nature of the business and the goods to be sold;
   4. If employed the name and address of the employer, together with credentials
establishing the exact relationship;
   5. The length of time for which the right to do business is desired;
   6. The place where the goods or property proposed to be sold or orders taken
for the sale thereof are manufactured or produced, where such goods or products      
are located at the time the application is filed, and the proposed method of
delivery;
   7. Two (2) photographs of the applicant, taken within sixty (60) days
immediately prior to the date of the filing of the application, which pictures
shall be 2" x 2" showing full front view of the head and shoulders of the
applicant in a clear and distinguishing manner;
   8. The fingerprints of the applicant and the names of at least two (2) reliable
property owners of the County, who will certify as to the applicant's good
character and business respectability or in lieu of the names of references, such
other available evidences as to the good character and business respectability of
the applicant as will enable an investigator to properly evaluate such character
and business responsibility;
   9. A statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of any
crime, misdemeanor or violation of any municipal law, the nature of the offense
and the punishment or penalty assessed therefor.
   At the time of filing the application, a fee shall be paid by the applicant to
the Clerk to cover the cost of investigation of the facts stated therein, in the   $ 25.00
sum of
   1. Upon receipt of such application, the Sheriff or Chief of Police shall cause
such investigation of the applicant's business and moral character to be made as
he deems necessary for the protection of the public goods; including the complete
fingerprinting of the applicant.
   If, as a result of such investigation, the applicant's character or business
responsibility is found to be unsatisfactory, the Sheriff or Chief of Police shall
endorse on such application his disapproval and his reasons for the same, and
shall notify the applicant that his application is disapproved and that no license
will be issued.
   If, as a result of such investigation, the character and business
responsibility of the applicant are found to be satisfactory, the Sheriff or Chief
of Police shall endorse on the application his approval and the Clerk shall issue
the license addressed to the applicant for the carrying on of the business applied
for and deliver the license to the applicant.
   2. The Sheriff or Chief of Police shall issue to each licensee at the time of
delivery of his license a badge which shall contain the words "Solicitor's
License" and the number of the license. Such badge shall, during the time such
licensee is engaged in soliciting be worn constantly by the licensee on the front
of his outer garment in such a way as to be conspicuous. The badge must be placed
in the hands of the Chief of Police or Sheriff at the conclusion of the visit to
the Town.
   3. Licenses issued under the provisions of this Section may be revoked by the
Town Board after notice and hearing for any of the following causes:
      a. Fraud, misrepresentation or false statement contained in the application
for license;
      b. Fraud, misrepresentation or false statement made in the course of
carrying on his business as solicitor or as canvasser;
      c. Any violation of this Chapter;
      d. Conviction of any crime or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude; or
      e. Conducting the business of soliciting or canvassing in an unlawful manner
or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a
menace to the health, safety or general welfare of the public.
   Notice of the hearing for the revocation of a license shall be given in
writing, setting forth specifically the grounds of complaint and the time and
place of hearing. Such notice shall be mailed, postage prepaid, to the licensee at
his last known address at least five (5) days prior to the date set for hearing.
   4. Any person aggrieved by the action of the Sheriff or Chief of Police in the
denial of a license as provided in this Chapter shall have the right of appeal to
the Town Board. Such appeal shall be taken by filing with the Board, within
fourteen (14) days after notice of the action complained of, a written statement
setting forth fully the grounds for the appeal. The Board shall set a time and
place for a hearing on such appeal and notice of such hearing shall be given to
the appellant in the same manner as provided in writing, notice to be mailed,
postage prepaid, to appellant at his last known address at least five (5) days
prior to the date set for hearing. The decision and order of the Town Board on
such appeal shall be final and conclusive.
   5. All solicitors` licenses shall expire on June 30 of the fiscal year when
issued.

officer or managing agent. The Clerk or any deputy Clerk may, in all cases,
examine the books and accounts of any person required to file such statement for
the purpose of verifying the same or for the purpose of determining the amount of
gross receipts of such person. All statements filed pursuant to the provisions of
this Section shall be confidential and shall not be subject to public inspection.
It shall be the duty of the Clerk to so preserve and keep the statements that the
contents thereof may not become known except to the person charged by law with the
administration of this Chapter. Any person who wilfully files a false statement of
gross receipts shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and punishable as hereinafter in
this Chapter provided. In the case of businesses making sales and rendering

6-1-13: CLASSIFICATION OF BUSINESSES:
In all cases not specifically named in this Chapter, the Clerk shall place the
business to be licensed in the category which he considers to be proper for the
business in question.
6-1-14: REVOCATION:
Whenever it shall appear to the Town Board that any trade, business,
occupation, calling or pursuit, for which a license has been granted, is being
conducted in such a manner as to be detrimental to the public peace, health or
morals, the Town Board at any regular or at any special meeting convened and
held for that purpose may, by majority vote, revoke, suspend or cancel the
license and declare the same to be of no further force and effect, and
thereafter it shall be unlawful for the licensee to maintain or conduct such
business under the license, or at all.
Upon such revocation, suspension or cancellation, no refund of any portion of
the license fee shall be made to the licensee and he shall immediately cease
all business at all places under such license.
6-1-15: REFUNDS:
All licenses shall be issued for the period of time set forth in this Chapter
and no licensee shall be entitled to the refund of any portion of the fee paid
by reason of the term of such licensed activity prior to the expiration of the
time for which such license shall have been issued. (Ord. 1967A, 10-6-67)
